page.title: 07INTERESTING BUILDINGS CONT.
page.content: {MANOR HOUSE__} Standing much as it did in 1574 when Thomas Metcalfe died there but with some windows altered and a porch added. The oldest documented house in the village and the frequent resort of Sister Dora Pattison whose sister Rachel lived there as Mrs. Robert Stirk, 1858-1877. {THE MILL HOUSE__}This has been converted into a residence but there is much evidence of its former use, notably the huge grinding stones. Old postcards of the mill with its waterwheel in place are still in existence. Water from the beck was used to drive the wheel and it is possible to find the site of the mill pond. An extensive study of the mill was done recently by a local schoolgirl.
